Posts.Content: penguin1 wrote: Hi!  I am new and have to visit a surgeon Monday regarding an excisional biopsy due to a finding of microcalcifications after mammos, sono, MRI and stereotactic biopsy have been done- I think this is truly to rule out any possiblity of cancer after all of these tests.  Does anyone have a list of questions to ask the surgeon during the appointment?  Thank you and I truly appreciate your help- this is all very new and I am trying to learn as I go. Dx 4/11/2013, DCIS, Stage 0, Grade 2, 0/2 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: questions to ask penguin1 ktym

Posts.Content: Feb 21, 2009 08:41AM penguin1 wrote: Wow, thank you Erica- you definitely had some new questions to ask that I hadn't thought about.  They had found microcalcs with hyperplasia after all test thus far had been completed.  I have a strong family history and my doctor is very cautious - as he says he keeps me on a 'short leash' as far as testing and not overlooking any possiblities.  I am 39 and have had mammos for about the past 5 years... this is my first real scare so I am trying to become a little more educated about where to go and what to ask.  There was no lump found, but my doctor said he was worried that the cells that are abnormal, although not cancer, can become aggressive and cause problems if not removed... especially with a family history. Thanks for any help you can give!! Michele (aka Penguin1)
Posts.Title: questions to ask penguin1 ktym

Posts.Content: Feb 21, 2009 10:41PM penguin1 wrote: Wow- It is somehow comforting to read about ladies going through exactly the same thing I am.  Thank you for posting your situations.  I am seeing a doctor for a 2nd opinion before an excisional biopsy for microcalcs on Monday.  I have already had several mammos, ultrasound, mri and Stereotactic biopsy to determine hyperplasia with microcalcs... nothing more as of yet.  I am looking for questions to ask the doctor.  Thanks for your posts and advice plus support. Michele
